page.title: 18Spring Wood,Whalley,Lancs.
page.content: To the east of Whalley village lies{ {Spring Wood,}a very popular nature park,a common haunt for ramblers and nature lovers. Spring Wood has always been a favourite spot for the{locals}but in the early 70's the area was developed and opened officially to the{public.} The wood is filled with a mixture of {deciduous}and{coniferous}trees and is famous for its spring time show of {bluebells. { }The public can enjoy the wood free of charge and can use the{picnic, {parking}and{toilet}facilities.There is also a{Nature Trail}which point out things of natural interest. Spring Wood can be reached by car via Whalley by-pass{A671}and from the village by foot via{Brookes Lane,}a picturesque walk well worth the time and effort.
